trans-unit.source: Manage web access with the managed browser | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage web access with the managed browser | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Deploy the managed browser application to restrict web browsing and the transfer of web data to other apps.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the managed browser application to restrict web browsing and the transfer of web data to other apps.

trans-unit.source: Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: The managed browser is a web browsing application that you can deploy in your organization by using Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: The managed browser is a web browsing application that you can deploy in your organization by using Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: A managed browser policy configures an allow list or a block list that restricts the websites that users of the managed browser can visit.
trans-unit.target: A managed browser policy configures an allow list or a block list that restricts the websites that users of the managed browser can visit.

trans-unit.source: Because this app is a managed app, you can also apply mobile application management policies to the app.
trans-unit.target: Because this app is a managed app, you can also apply mobile application management policies to the app.

trans-unit.source: These policies might include controlling the use of cut, copy, and paste, preventing screen captures, and ensuring that links to content that users select open only in other managed apps.
trans-unit.target: These policies might include controlling the use of cut, copy, and paste, preventing screen captures, and ensuring that links to content that users select open only in other managed apps.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md).

trans-unit.source: If users install the managed browser from the app store and Intune does not manage it, the following behavior applies:
trans-unit.target: If users install the managed browser from the app store and Intune does not manage it, the following behavior applies:

trans-unit.source: iOS – The managed browser app can be used as a basic web browser, but some features will not be available, and it will not be able to access data from other Intune-managed apps.
trans-unit.target: iOS – The managed browser app can be used as a basic web browser, but some features will not be available, and it will not be able to access data from other Intune-managed apps.

trans-unit.source: Android – The managed browser app cannot be used.
trans-unit.target: Android – The managed browser app cannot be used.

trans-unit.source: If users install the managed browser themselves on an iOS device with a version earlier than iOS 9, no policies that you create will manage the browser.
trans-unit.target: If users install the managed browser themselves on an iOS device with a version earlier than iOS 9, no policies that you create will manage the browser.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that Intune manages the browser, users must uninstall the app before you can deploy it to them as a managed app.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that Intune manages the browser, users must uninstall the app before you can deploy it to them as a managed app.

trans-unit.source: On iOS 9 and later, if users install the managed browser themselves, they will be prompted to allow it to become managed by policy.
trans-unit.target: On iOS 9 and later, if users install the managed browser themselves, they will be prompted to allow it to become managed by policy.

trans-unit.source: You can create managed browser policies for the following device types:
trans-unit.target: You can create managed browser policies for the following device types:

trans-unit.source: Devices that run Android 4 and later
trans-unit.target: Devices that run Android 4 and later

trans-unit.source: Devices that run iOS 8.0 and later
trans-unit.target: Devices that run iOS 8.0 and later

trans-unit.source: The Intune managed browser supports opening web content from [Microsoft Intune application partners](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The Intune managed browser supports opening web content from [Microsoft Intune application partners](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Create a managed browser policy
trans-unit.target: Create a managed browser policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Configure one of the following **Software** policy types:
trans-unit.target: Configure one of the following **Software** policy types:

trans-unit.source: **Managed Browser (Android 4 and later)**
trans-unit.target: **Managed Browser (Android 4 and later)**

trans-unit.source: **Managed Browser (iOS 8.0 and later)**
trans-unit.target: **Managed Browser (iOS 8.0 and later)**

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune Policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune Policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to help you configure the managed browser policy settings:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to help you configure the managed browser policy settings:

trans-unit.source: **Name**.
trans-unit.target: **Name**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the managed browser policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the managed browser policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: **Description**.
trans-unit.target: **Description**.

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the managed browser policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the managed browser policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: **Enable an allow list or block list to restrict the URLs the Managed Browser can open**.
trans-unit.target: **Enable an allow list or block list to restrict the URLs the Managed Browser can open**.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: **Allow the managed browser to open only the URLs listed below**.
trans-unit.target: **Allow the managed browser to open only the URLs listed below**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser can open.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser can open.

trans-unit.source: **Block the managed browser from opening the URLs listed below**.
trans-unit.target: **Block the managed browser from opening the URLs listed below**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser will be blocked from opening.
trans-unit.target: Specify a list of URLs that the managed browser will be blocked from opening.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** You cannot include both allowed and blocked URLs in the same managed browser policy.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** You cannot include both allowed and blocked URLs in the same managed browser policy.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the URL formats you can specify, see **URL format for allowed and blocked URLs** in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the URL formats you can specify, see **URL format for allowed and blocked URLs** in this topic.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, choose **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, choose **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: The new policy appears in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy appears in the **Configuration Policies** node of the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Create a deployment for the managed browser app
trans-unit.target: Create a deployment for the managed browser app

trans-unit.source: After you have created the managed browser policy, you can then create a software deployment for the managed browser app, and associate it with the managed browser policy that you created.
trans-unit.target: After you have created the managed browser policy, you can then create a software deployment for the managed browser app, and associate it with the managed browser policy that you created.

trans-unit.source: Managed browser policies are not deployed in the same way as other Intune polices.
trans-unit.target: Managed browser policies are not deployed in the same way as other Intune polices.

trans-unit.source: This type of policy must be associated with the managed browser software package.
trans-unit.target: This type of policy must be associated with the managed browser software package.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the app, ensuring that you select the managed browser policy on the **Mobile App Management** page to associate the policy with the app.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the app, ensuring that you select the managed browser policy on the **Mobile App Management** page to associate the policy with the app.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to deploy apps, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to deploy apps, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Security and privacy for the managed browser
trans-unit.target: Security and privacy for the managed browser

trans-unit.source: On iOS devices, websites that users visit that have an expired or untrusted certificate cannot be opened.
trans-unit.target: On iOS devices, websites that users visit that have an expired or untrusted certificate cannot be opened.

trans-unit.source: The managed browser does not use settings that users make for the built-in browser on their devices.
trans-unit.target: The managed browser does not use settings that users make for the built-in browser on their devices.

trans-unit.source: This is because the managed browser does not have access to these settings.
trans-unit.target: This is because the managed browser does not have access to these settings.

trans-unit.source: If you configure the option **Require simple PIN for access** or **Require corporate credentials for access** in a mobile application management policy associated with the managed browser, and a user selects the help link on the authentication page, they can then browse any Internet sites regardless of whether they were added to a block list in the managed browser policy.
trans-unit.target: If you configure the option **Require simple PIN for access** or **Require corporate credentials for access** in a mobile application management policy associated with the managed browser, and a user selects the help link on the authentication page, they can then browse any Internet sites regardless of whether they were added to a block list in the managed browser policy.

trans-unit.source: The managed browser can block access to sites only when they are accessed directly.
trans-unit.target: The managed browser can block access to sites only when they are accessed directly.

trans-unit.source: It cannot block access when intermediate services (such as a translation service) are used to access the site.
trans-unit.target: It cannot block access when intermediate services (such as a translation service) are used to access the site.

trans-unit.source: To allow authentication, and to ensure that the Intune documentation can be accessed,***.microsoft.com** is exempt from the allow or block list settings.
trans-unit.target: To allow authentication, and to ensure that the Intune documentation can be accessed,***.microsoft.com** is exempt from the allow or block list settings.

trans-unit.source: It is always allowed.
trans-unit.target: It is always allowed.

trans-unit.source: Turn off usage data
trans-unit.target: Turn off usage data

trans-unit.source: Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the performance and use of the managed browser to improve Microsoft products and services.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the performance and use of the managed browser to improve Microsoft products and services.

trans-unit.source: Users can turn off data collection by using the **Usage Data** setting on their devices.
trans-unit.target: Users can turn off data collection by using the **Usage Data** setting on their devices.

trans-unit.source: You have no control over the collection of this data.
trans-unit.target: You have no control over the collection of this data.

trans-unit.source: Reference information
trans-unit.target: Reference information

trans-unit.source: URL format for allowed and blocked URLs
trans-unit.target: URL format for allowed and blocked URLs

trans-unit.source: Use the following information to learn about the allowed formats and wildcards that you can use when specifying URLs in the allowed and blocked lists:
trans-unit.target: Use the following information to learn about the allowed formats and wildcards that you can use when specifying URLs in the allowed and blocked lists:

trans-unit.source: You can use the wildcard symbol (*****) according to the rules in the following permitted patterns list.
trans-unit.target: You can use the wildcard symbol (*****) according to the rules in the following permitted patterns list.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you prefix all URLs with **http** or **https** when entering them into the list.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you prefix all URLs with **http** or **https** when entering them into the list.

trans-unit.source: You can specify port numbers in the address.
trans-unit.target: You can specify port numbers in the address.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a port number, the values used will be:
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify a port number, the values used will be:

trans-unit.source: Port 80 for http
trans-unit.target: Port 80 for http

trans-unit.source: Port 443 for https
trans-unit.target: Port 443 for https

trans-unit.source: Using wildcards for the port number is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Using wildcards for the port number is not supported.

trans-unit.source: For example, **http://www.contoso.com:*;** and **http://www.contoso.com: /*;** are not supported.
trans-unit.target: For example, **http://www.contoso.com:*;** and **http://www.contoso.com: /*;** are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to learn about the permitted patterns that you can use when you specify URLs:
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to learn about the permitted patterns that you can use when you specify URLs:

trans-unit.source: URL
trans-unit.target: URL

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.target: Matches

trans-unit.source: Does not match
trans-unit.target: Does not match

trans-unit.target: http://www.contoso.com

trans-unit.target: Matches a single page

trans-unit.target: www.contoso.com

trans-unit.target: host.contoso.com

trans-unit.target: www.contoso.com/images

trans-unit.target: contoso.com/

trans-unit.target: http://contoso.com

trans-unit.target: http://www.contoso.com:*

trans-unit.target: http://www.contoso.com: /*

trans-unit.source: How conflicts between the allow and block list are resolved
trans-unit.target: How conflicts between the allow and block list are resolved

trans-unit.source: If multiple managed browser policies are deployed to a device and the settings conflict, both the mode (allow or block) and the URL lists are evaluated for conflicts.
trans-unit.target: If multiple managed browser policies are deployed to a device and the settings conflict, both the mode (allow or block) and the URL lists are evaluated for conflicts.

trans-unit.source: In case of a conflict, the following behavior applies:
trans-unit.target: In case of a conflict, the following behavior applies:

trans-unit.source: If the modes in each policy are the same, but the URL lists are different, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.
trans-unit.target: If the modes in each policy are the same, but the URL lists are different, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.

trans-unit.source: If the modes in each policy are different, but the URL lists are the same, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.
trans-unit.target: If the modes in each policy are different, but the URL lists are the same, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.

trans-unit.source: If a device is receiving managed browser policies for the first time and two policies conflict, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.
trans-unit.target: If a device is receiving managed browser policies for the first time and two policies conflict, the URLs will not be enforced on the device.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Policy Conflicts** node of the **Policy** workspace to view the conflicts.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Policy Conflicts** node of the **Policy** workspace to view the conflicts.

trans-unit.source: If a device has already received a managed browser policy and a second policy is deployed with conflicting settings, the original settings remain on the device.
trans-unit.target: If a device has already received a managed browser policy and a second policy is deployed with conflicting settings, the original settings remain on the device.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Policy Conflicts** node of the **Policy** workspace to view the conflicts.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Policy Conflicts** node of the **Policy** workspace to view the conflicts.
